title:
Chernoff's product formula: Semigroup approximations with non-uniform
  time intervals
authors: J. Z. Bern\'ad, A. B. Frigyik
abstract:
Often, when we consider the time evolution of a system, we resort to
approximation: Instead of calculating the exact orbit, we divide the time
interval in question into uniform segments. Chernoff's results in this
direction provide us with a general approximation scheme. There are situations
when we need to break the interval into uneven pieces. In this paper, we
explore alternative conditions to the one found by Smolyanov et. al such that
Chernoff's original result can be extended to unevenly distributed time
intervals. Two applications concerning the foundations of quantum mechanics and
the central limit theorem are presented.
